user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Blue screen before login. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Blue screen before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Blue screen before login - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Credential login loop' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Credential login loop' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Credential login loop - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'CSM/UEFI conflict' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'CSM/UEFI conflict' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: CSM/UEFI conflict - Boot error logged in system event.

step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: CSM/UEFI conflict - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Corrupt system32 files' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Corrupt system32 files' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Corrupt system32 files - Boot error logged in system event.

error_name: GPU driver crash causing black screen on boot
user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'GPU driver crash causing black screen on boot' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'GPU driver crash causing black screen on boot' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: GPU driver crash causing black screen on boot - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Black screen with spinning dots' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Black screen with spinning dots' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Black screen with spinning dots - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'TPM boot error' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'TPM boot error' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Firmware misconfiguration, wrong boot mode, or incompatible BIOS settings.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: TPM boot error - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Motherboard not POSTing' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Motherboard not POSTing' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Motherboard not POSTing - Boot error logged in system event.

error_name: Config\System is missing or contains errors
user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Config\System is missing or contains errors' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Config\System is missing or contains errors' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Config\System is missing or contains errors - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Startup settings not loading' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Startup settings not loading' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Startup settings not loading - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Beeping sound hardware error code' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Beeping sound hardware error code' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'BCD missing or corrupted' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BCD missing or corrupted' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BCD missing or corrupted - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'Stuck at 'Welcome' or 'Preparing Windows'' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Stuck at 'Welcome' or 'Preparing Windows'' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Stuck at 'Welcome' or 'Preparing Windows' - Boot error logged in system event.

symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR compressed' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR compressed - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Corrupt system32 files. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Corrupt system32 files' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Corrupt system32 files - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'winload.efi is missing' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'winload.efi is missing' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: winload.efi is missing - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Storage driver failed to initialize appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.

cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'CSM/UEFI conflict' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'CSM/UEFI conflict' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: CSM/UEFI conflict - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Diagnosing your PC stuck' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Diagnosing your PC stuck' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Diagnosing your PC stuck - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Beeping sound hardware error code appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Beeping sound hardware error code' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Beeping sound hardware error code - Boot error logged in system event.

error_name: Laptop screen stays black, external monitor works
user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Laptop screen stays black, external monitor works' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Laptop screen stays black, external monitor works' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Laptop screen stays black, external monitor works - Boot error logged in system event.

step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Automatic Repair couldn't repair your PC - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: System Registry Hive corrupted. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'System Registry Hive corrupted' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: System Registry Hive corrupted - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Wrong Boot Mode (Legacy vs UEFI)' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Wrong Boot Mode (Legacy vs UEFI)' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Wrong Boot Mode (Legacy vs UEFI) - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Display driver fails before login appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Display driver fails before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Display driver fails before login - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: CPU/Memory initialization error appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'CPU/Memory initialization error' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: CPU/Memory initialization error - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'BOOTMGR is missing' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR is missing' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR is missing - Boot error logged in system event.

symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'User profile corrupted on boot' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Blue screen before login. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Blue screen before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Blue screen before login - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: BOOTMGR is missing. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR is missing' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR is missing - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'TPM boot error' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'TPM boot error' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Firmware misconfiguration, wrong boot mode, or incompatible BIOS settings.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: TPM boot error - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'S.M.A.R.T. disk errors' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'S.M.A.R.T. disk errors' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: S.M.A.R.T. disk errors - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: CPU/Memory initialization error appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'CPU/Memory initialization error' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: CPU/Memory initialization error - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at '0xc000000f – Boot configuration error' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error '0xc000000f – Boot configuration error' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: 0xc000000f – Boot configuration error - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Startup settings not loading' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Startup settings not loading' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Startup settings not loading - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Automatic Repair stuck appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Automatic Repair stuck' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Automatic Repair stuck - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Storage driver failed to initialize. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Storage driver failed to initialize' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Storage driver failed to initialize - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'FAT_FILE_SYSTEM' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'FAT_FILE_SYSTEM' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: FAT_FILE_SYSTEM - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'User Profile Cannot Be Loaded' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'User Profile Cannot Be Loaded' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: User Profile Cannot Be Loaded - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Display driver fails before login. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Display driver fails before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Display driver fails before login - Boot error logged in system event.

step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: ACPI driver failures - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Loose or failing SSD/HDD' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Loose or failing SSD/HDD' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Loose or failing SSD/HDD - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'TPM boot error' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'TPM boot error' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Firmware misconfiguration, wrong boot mode, or incompatible BIOS settings.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: TPM boot error - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'User Profile Cannot Be Loaded' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'User Profile Cannot Be Loaded' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: User Profile Cannot Be Loaded - Boot error logged in system event.

error_name: Windows cannot find system files required for boot
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Windows cannot find system files required for boot' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Windows cannot find system files required for boot' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Windows cannot find system files required for boot - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Display driver fails before login' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Display driver fails before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Display driver fails before login - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'BOOTMGR compressed' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR compressed' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR compressed - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Startup settings not loading' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Startup settings not loading' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Startup settings not loading - Boot error logged in system event.

step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Black screen with spinning dots - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'BOOTMGR is missing' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR is missing' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR is missing - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: winload.efi is missing appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'winload.efi is missing' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: winload.efi is missing - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Stuck at 'Welcome' or 'Preparing Windows'. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Stuck at 'Welcome' or 'Preparing Windows'' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Stuck at 'Welcome' or 'Preparing Windows' - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: ACPI driver failures appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'ACPI driver failures' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: ACPI driver failures - Boot error logged in system event.

cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Secure Boot violation' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Secure Boot violation' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Firmware misconfiguration, wrong boot mode, or incompatible BIOS settings.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Secure Boot violation - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Blue screen before login' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Blue screen before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.

log_snippet: Blue screen before login - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Motherboard not POSTing' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Motherboard not POSTing' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Motherboard not POSTing - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop - Boot error logged in system event.

step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Beeping sound hardware error code - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'Diagnosing your PC stuck' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Diagnosing your PC stuck' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Diagnosing your PC stuck - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'Black screen with spinning dots' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Black screen with spinning dots' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Black screen with spinning dots - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'BOOTMGR compressed' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR compressed' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR compressed - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Secure Boot violation. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Secure Boot violation' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Firmware misconfiguration, wrong boot mode, or incompatible BIOS settings.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Secure Boot violation - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: User Profile Cannot Be Loaded. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'User Profile Cannot Be Loaded' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: User Profile Cannot Be Loaded - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: No boot device detected. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'No boot device detected' during early boot. Observed in category: Hardware Startup Failures.
cause: Physical hardware failure (drive, RAM, motherboard) or loose connections.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and re-seat all internal drive and memory connections.
step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: No boot device detected - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: I'm stuck at 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' every time I start my computer.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'Blue screen before login' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Blue screen before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Blue screen before login - Boot error logged in system event.

step_2: Listen for beep codes and consult the motherboard manual to identify hardware faults.
step_3: Disconnect non-essential peripherals and try booting with minimal hardware.
step_4: Run vendor diagnostics or bootable hardware tests (drive/RAM/CPU stress tests).
step_5: Replace identified failing hardware (drive, RAM, PSU) and restore from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Loose or failing SSD/HDD - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.
step_4: Use System Restore to revert to a known good point if available.
step_5: If repair fails, back up files via recovery environment and consider reinstalling Windows.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Preparing Automatic Repair → Restart Loop' during early boot. Observed in category: Automatic Repair / Startup Repair Loop.
cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.
step_1: Let Automatic Repair run once; if looped, choose 'Advanced options' → 'Troubleshoot'.
step_2: From Advanced options open Command Prompt and run `chkdsk C: /f /r`.
step_3: Disable automatic restart to capture any error messages: System Properties → Advanced → Startup and Recovery.

user_error_text: S.M.A.R.T. disk errors appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'S.M.A.R.T. disk errors' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: S.M.A.R.T. disk errors - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: FAT_FILE_SYSTEM appears and then the machine hangs with a black screen.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'FAT_FILE_SYSTEM' during early boot. Observed in category: Disk / File System Corruption.
cause: File system corruption, failing disk, or damaged boot sector.
step_1: Boot into Recovery Environment and run `chkdsk C: /f /r` from Command Prompt.
step_2: Check SMART status using disk tools (CrystalDiskInfo or vendor utilities).
step_3: Run `bootrec /scanos` and `bootrec /rebuildbcd` if BCD issues are suspected.
step_4: If filesystem is raw or corrupted, attempt data recovery before formatting.
step_5: Replace the drive if SMART indicates physical failure and restore data from backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: FAT_FILE_SYSTEM - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'BOOTMGR compressed' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BOOTMGR compressed' during early boot. Observed in category: Bootloader / Boot Manager Errors.
cause: Bootloader or BCD corruption, wrong active partition, or missing boot files.
step_1: Restart and enter BIOS/UEFI settings (commonly F2/F10/DEL) to check boot order.
step_2: Ensure the Windows drive is set as the first boot device and save changes.
step_3: Boot from Windows installation media and select 'Repair your computer' → 'Startup Repair'.
step_4: If Startup Repair fails, open Command Prompt and run: `bootrec /fixmbr`, `bootrec /fixboot`, `bootrec /rebuildbcd`.
step_5: If drive errors persist, connect the drive to another PC to verify disk health.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BOOTMGR compressed - Boot error logged in system event.

cause: Windows startup repair cannot fix underlying disk or boot configuration issues.

user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup' during early boot. Observed in category: Driver Loading Failures at Boot.
cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.
step_4: If storage drivers cause INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE, ensure correct SATA/RAID drivers are present.
step_5: If driver fixes fail, use System Restore or restore drivers from known-good backup.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED at startup - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'User profile corrupted on boot' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'User profile corrupted on boot' during early boot. Observed in category: Password / User Profile Boot Issues.
cause: Corrupt user profile or issues loading user registry hive during sign-in.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and create a new local admin account to check if profile loads.
step_2: Use `net user` commands in recovery to reset passwords if credential loop prevents login.
step_3: Rename the corrupted user profile folder and create a new profile to migrate data.
step_4: Run `sfc /scannow` to fix any system-side issues preventing profile load.
step_5: Restore user registry hive from backup if available, or restore system to earlier point.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: User profile corrupted on boot - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'BIOS cannot detect boot disk' and won't boot past this message.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'BIOS cannot detect boot disk' during early boot. Observed in category: BIOS / UEFI Firmware Misconfiguration.
cause: Firmware misconfiguration, wrong boot mode, or incompatible BIOS settings.
step_1: Enter BIOS/UEFI and reset to factory/default settings.
step_2: Switch boot mode between UEFI and Legacy only if necessary for your disk type.
step_3: Ensure Secure Boot and TPM settings match your OS requirements or temporarily disable them.
step_4: Update BIOS/UEFI firmware only using the vendor's official tool and instructions.
step_5: Check that the boot disk is detected in BIOS; re-seat drive cables if not detected.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: BIOS cannot detect boot disk - Boot error logged in system event.

user_error_text: After the last update, I get 'Display driver fails before login' and Windows doesn't start.
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Display driver fails before login' during early boot. Observed in category: Display / GPU Boot Issues.
cause: GPU/Display driver or hardware failure preventing image output during boot.
step_1: Check external monitor and cable connections; try a different cable or port.
step_2: If external monitor shows output, the laptop panel may be faulty—test with external display.
step_3: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall display drivers, then reboot to allow Windows to reinstall drivers.
step_4: Reset BIOS display settings and ensure GPU is seated correctly (desktop).
step_5: If no display at all, check power to monitor and test GPU in another system if possible.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Display driver fails before login - Boot error logged in system event.

cause: Required storage or chipset driver failed to load during early boot.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode (F8/Shift+Restart) and check Device Manager for driver errors.
step_2: Uninstall the problematic driver and reboot to allow Windows to use a generic driver.
step_3: Download and install the correct driver directly from the device manufacturer's website.

error_name: Config\System is missing or contains errors
user_error_text: Can't boot — the screen says: Config\System is missing or contains errors. What do I do?
symptoms: System fails to start normally; shows error 'Config\System is missing or contains errors' during early boot. Observed in category: Missing or Damaged System Files.
cause: Missing or corrupted system files required for boot (winload, hal, registry hive).
step_1: Boot to recovery and run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files.
step_2: Run `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to fix Windows image corruption.
step_3: If winload.efi or hal.dll missing, copy these from a matching Windows install media.
step_4: Use System Restore to return to a point before corruption occurred.
step_5: If missing files cannot be restored, perform an in-place upgrade/repair with installation media.
verification: System boots normally to Windows and user can log in without errors.
log_snippet: Config\System is missing or contains errors - Boot error logged in system event.
